Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

parts: What are the movies starring Frank Drebin

content.text: search("What are the movies starring Frank Drebin")

parts:
iturn0image2Frank Drebin, portrayed by Leslie Nielsen, is the central character in the *Naked Gun* film series, known for its slapstick humor and parody of police procedurals. Originating from the short-lived 1982 TV series *Police Squad!*, Drebin's character transitioned to film with notable success.

### Films Featuring Frank Drebin

1. **The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)**  
   In this inaugural film, Lieutenant Frank Drebin endeavors to thwart an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth II during her visit to Los Angeles. The plot involves a mind-control scheme orchestrated by businessman Vincent Ludwig. The film is celebrated for its rapid-fire gags and Nielsen's impeccable deadpan delivery. citeturn0search24

2. **The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear (1991)**  
   Drebin uncovers a conspiracy to replace a prominent scientist with an imposter to manipulate national energy policy. The narrative intertwines political satire with Drebin's personal challenges, including rekindling a relationship with his ex-girlfriend, Jane Spencer. citeturn0search4

3. **Naked Gun 33⅓: The Final Insult (1994)**  
   Now retired, Drebin is drawn back into action to infiltrate a prison and prevent a terrorist plot targeting the Academy Awards. The film maintains the series' hallmark humor, featuring exaggerated scenarios and Drebin's characteristic blunders. citeturn0search4

### Upcoming Reboot: *The Naked Gun* (2025)

A new installment in the franchise is slated for release on August 1, 2025. This reboot introduces Liam Neeson as Frank Drebin Jr., the son of the original character. Directed by Akiva Schaffer and produced by Seth MacFarlane, the film aims to honor the original's comedic legacy while introducing contemporary elements. The cast includes Pamela Anderson, Paul Walter Hauser, and WWE star Cody Rhodes. The teaser trailer showcases Neeson's character in humorous scenarios, indicating a blend of action and comedy reminiscent of the original films. citeturn0news26turn0news27

The *Naked Gun* series remains a significant contribution to the spoof comedy genre, with Leslie Nielsen's portrayal of Frank Drebin leaving a lasting impact on audiences.

items.title: Liam Neeson is beating up bank robbers while wearing a skirt in first trailer for The Naked Gun reboot from The Lonely Island director
items.snippet: The first trailer for the reboot of The Naked Gun has been released, featuring Liam Neeson in the lead role of Frank Drebin Jr., the son of the original character played by Leslie Nielsen. The reboot revives the slapstick comedy legacy of the original franchise, which began with the TV series Police Squad and continued through three films released between 1988 and 1994. Though the franchise waned in popularity with its sequels, the new film aims to bring back its comedic charm, largely playing on the humorous name similarity between Neeson and Nielsen. Known more for his action roles, Neeson embraces the over-the-top absurdity reminiscent of the original films. The reboot is produced by Seth MacFarlane and directed by Akiva Shaffer, a member of The Lonely Island comedy troupe, suggesting a strong comedic background for the project. The film is set for theatrical release on August 1, 2025, and will feature a diverse cast including Pamela Anderson, Paul Walter Hauser, Busta Rhymes, and WWE Champion Cody Rhodes.

items.title: Everything we know about "The Naked Gun" reboot: Release date, cast, and how it acknowledges O.J. Simpson's role in the original
items.snippet: The reboot of the iconic comedy franchise The Naked Gun is set to be released on August 1, 2025, directed by Akiva Schaffer of the Lonely Island and produced by Seth MacFarlane. The film is a direct sequel to the original trilogy and stars Liam Neeson as Lt. Frank Drebin Jr., son of Leslie Nielsen’s character. Neeson's background in dramatic roles makes him a fitting straight-faced lead for the slapstick, irreverent comedy. Paul Walter Hauser joins as Ed Hocken Jr., alongside a supporting cast that includes Pamela Anderson, Liza Koshy, Danny Houston, Kevin Durand, WWE star Cody Rhodes, and rapper Busta Rhymes. The teaser trailer, shown at CinemaCon, showcases the film’s commitment to absurd humor and acknowledges the controversial role of O.J. Simpson in the original series with a tongue-in-cheek reference. The reboot maintains the spirit of the original with over-the-top gags and deadpan delivery while updating characters for a modern audience.

parts: Any other films by Leslie Nielsen?

content.text: search("Any other films by Leslie Nielsen?")

parts:
iturn0image1turn0image2turn0image3turn0image6Leslie Nielsen's filmography spans over five decades, encompassing a diverse range of genres and roles. Below is a curated selection of his most notable films, highlighting his versatility and transition from dramatic roles to comedic performances.

---

### 🎭 Early Dramatic Roles (1950s–1970s)

Before becoming synonymous with comedy, Nielsen established himself in dramatic and science fiction roles:

- **Forbidden Planet** (1956) – Portrayed Commander John J. Adams in this pioneering sci-fi classic.

- **The Poseidon Adventure** (1972) – Played Captain Harrison in this disaster film.

- **The Sheepman** (1958) – Featured as Colonel Stephen Bedford in this Western.

- **Day of the Animals** (1977) – Took on the role of Paul Jenson in this eco-horror film.

---

### 😂 Comedic Breakthrough and Parody Films (1980s–1990s)

Nielsen's shift to comedy was marked by his impeccable deadpan delivery:

- **Airplane!** (1980) – As Dr. Rumack, delivered the iconic line, "Don't call me Shirley."

- **The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!** (1988) – Introduced audiences to the bumbling Lt. Frank Drebin.

- **The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear** (1991) and **Naked Gun 33⅓: The Final Insult** (1994) – Continued the misadventures of Lt. Drebin.

- **Repossessed** (1990) – Parodied "The Exorcist," with Nielsen as Father Jebedaiah Mayii.

- **Dracula: Dead and Loving It** (1995) – Teamed up with Mel Brooks to spoof vampire lore.

- **Spy Hard** (1996) – Played Agent WD-40 in this James Bond parody.

- **Wrongfully Accused** (1998) – Satirized action thrillers, notably "The Fugitive."

---

### 🧒 Family and Animated Features

Nielsen also ventured into family-friendly content:

- **Mr. Magoo** (1997) – Brought the near-sighted cartoon character to life.

- **Santa Who?** (2000) – Portrayed a Santa Claus with amnesia.

- **All I Want for Christmas** (1991) – Featured as a department store Santa.

---

### 🧟‍♂️ Later Career and Parody Revivals (2000s)

In his later years, Nielsen continued to embrace parody roles:

- **Scary Movie 3** (2003) and **Scary Movie 4** (2006) – Played President Harris in these horror-comedy spoofs.

- **Superhero Movie** (2008) – Took on the role of Uncle Albert in this superhero satire.

- **Stan Helsing** (2009) – Appeared as Kay in this horror parody.

---

For a comprehensive list of Leslie Nielsen's filmography, you can refer to his [Wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leslie_Nielsen_filmography) or [IMDb profile](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0000558/).

If you're interested in exploring his television appearances or specific genres, feel free to ask!
